Aardvark.desc: Aardvark is a maze-based action game where reflexes and precision are key. You control an aardvark using its long tongue to collect insects from underground tunnels while avoiding aggressive enemies that can cost you a life. Timing your tongue extensions and retractions is essential to clear each level safely.

Bruce Lee.desc: In Bruce Lee, you must infiltrate a wizard's tower to claim his legendary fortune. This hybrid of platformer and brawler tasks you with collecting lanterns to open new passages while fighting off a relentless Ninja and the hulking Green Yamo. With its fast-paced action and the ability for a second player to control one of the antagonists, it remains one of the most fun and fluid experiences on the C64.

Bubble Bobble.desc: Control the bubble-blowing dragons Bub and Bob in this legendary arcade platformer. Your mission is to rescue their girlfriends by navigating 100 levels of monsters. Trap enemies in bubbles and pop them to progress, while collecting fruit and power-ups for high scores. Cooperative play is the heart of the experience, as you work together to discover hidden secrets and the true ending.

Dig Dug.desc: The 1983 Atarisoft classic brings the hit arcade game to the C64. As Dig Dug, you must tunnel through the earth and eliminate the Pookas and Fygars that lurk underground. You can either pump them full of air until they explode or drop heavy rocks to crush them. This version is a nostalgic staple of the C64 library, known for its catchy music and addictive gameplay loop.

Double Dragon.desc: The quintessential beat 'em up comes to the C64. Brothers Billy and Jimmy Lee take to the streets to rescue Marian from the Black Warriors gang. Fight through urban slums, factories, and forests using punches, kicks, and weapons dropped by enemies. The game is best enjoyed with a friend in simultaneous cooperative mode, cleaning up the streets together.

Fi$tful of Buck$.desc: Fi$tful of Buck$ is an arcade-style western shooter where reflexes and timing are everything. You control a gunslinger navigating through hostile towns and open desert areas, facing waves of enemies intent on stopping you.

Galaga.desc: A legendary fixed shooter and successor to Galaxian, Galaga tasks you with defending the galaxy against swarms of insect-like aliens. Watch out for Boss Galagas that can use a tractor beam to capture your ship; rescuing it allows you to control two ships at once for double the firepower. Master the enemy patterns and the 'Challenging Stages' to achieve a high score.

Galaga (Arlasoft).desc: This 2024 conversion by Arlasoft is a highly accurate port of the original Namco arcade classic. Defend your ship against relentless waves of insect-like aliens that dive-bomb and capture your fighter. This version captures the exact enemy behaviors, fire rates, and 'Challenging Stages' of the arcade, offering the most authentic Galaga experience on the Commodore 64.

Galencia.desc: A breathtaking modern tribute to Galaga, Galencia brings elite production values to the C64. Battle through 50 levels of insectoid swarms, featuring boss fights, challenging bonus rounds, and beautiful starfield effects. With its polished graphics and pulse-pounding soundtrack, it’s often cited as the gold standard for modern arcade experiences on 8-bit hardware.

Get Off my Garden!.desc: In Get Off My Garden!, you take control of a General Agricultural Robot Functionary (G.A.R.F.) in a side‑view, single‑screen action/shooter setup. Your main goal is to grow six special plants (Aquaronum Upshootus) in your garden while defending them from waves of hostile creatures that try to destroy them.

Ghostbusters.desc: You manage a team of paranormal hunters across a city map, responding to ghost sightings and capturing spirits before PK energy reaches critical levels. Action scenes shift to side-view traps where you position both Ghostbusters and guide ghosts into the trap without crossing the streams.

Ghosts 'n Goblins.desc: Take control of Sir Arthur in this uncompromisingly difficult arcade port. You must fight through hordes of zombies, demons, and undead knights to rescue the Princess from the Demon King. Arthur can collect various projectile weapons like lances and daggers, but one hit will shatter his armor, leaving him to finish the quest in his boxers. It is a masterpiece of dark fantasy atmosphere and unforgiving challenge.

Guns 'n' Ghosts.desc: In Guns 'n' Ghosts, you play as paranormal investigators Trev and Justin in a fast-paced battle against the undead. This modern homebrew hit features single-screen arena combat where you must blast waves of ghosts, skeletons, and bosses. With its smooth animations, power-ups, and a fantastic simultaneous two-player mode, it's a perfect blend of retro arcade feel and modern polish.

Gremlins.desc: Gremlins is an action game based on the 1984 film. In the first stage, you play as Billy Peltzer, running across the screen to catch falling Mogwai before they reach the food and transform. In the second stage, the Mogwai have turned into Gremlins and are hiding behind refrigerators; you must eliminate them with a sword before they multiply and swarm the screen. It's a high-speed test of reflexes across two distinct challenges.

IK+.desc: IK+ is the definitive martial arts experience on the C64, featuring fast-paced three-way karate matches. Unlike traditional fighters, you must outscore two opponents simultaneously to avoid elimination. The game is famous for its fluid animation, iconic Rob Hubbard soundtrack, and bonus rounds involving deflecting bouncing balls or kicking away bombs to stay in the tournament.

Laser Squad.desc: Laser Squad is a seminal tactical turn-based combat game. You command a small squad of troopers through various missions, from assassinations to rescue operations. Each unit has limited Action Points (AP) to spend on movement, aiming, and firing. The game's depth lies in its armor penetration mechanics, line-of-sight rules, and morale system, laying the groundwork for the future X-COM series.

Maniac Mansion.desc: Maniac Mansion is the revolutionary adventure game that introduced the SCUMM system. You lead a group of three teenagers infiltrating Dr. Fred's mansion to rescue Sandy. The game features multiple playable characters with unique abilities, several possible endings, and quirky humor, all managed through an action-verb interface.

Nobby the Aardvark.desc: Nobby the Aardvark is a visually stunning multi-stage platformer. You guide Nobby through diverse levels—ranging from traditional jumping puzzles to maze-like tunnels and even flight sequences—on his quest to reach Antropia. Armed with a tongue attack and collectible ants for ammo, you must navigate tricky terrain and defeat surreal enemies in one of the C64's most polished late-era titles.

Pitfall!.desc: In Pitfall!, you guide Pitfall Harry through a perilous jungle to recover 32 treasures within a 20-minute time limit. You must swing on vines, leap over pits, and avoid deadly obstacles like scorpions, crocodiles, and rolling logs. Navigating both the surface and the underground tunnels is key to finding the most efficient path through the 255 screens of adventure.

Pitstop II.desc: You pilot an F1 car in split-screen, balancing high-speed racing with resource strategy. Beyond overtaking rivals, you must monitor tire wear and fuel, triggering manual pit stops where you control the crew to refuel and swap tires quickly before jumping back into the heat of the race.

Prince of Persia.desc: In Prince of Persia, you have only 60 minutes to escape the Sultan's dungeons and stop the evil Vizier Jaffar. Renowned for its lifelike rotoscoped animation, the game requires pixel-perfect jumping, sword fighting, and trap navigation. You must carefully explore the palace's depths, find a sword, and overcome guards and skeletons to rescue the Princess before time runs out.

Sam's Journey.desc: Sam's Journey is a massive, modern platforming epic for the C64. Explore a vast world with over 30 levels and thousands of screens. Sam can change his abilities by finding different costumes, turning him into a pirate, a vampire, or even a ninja. With its colorful graphics, smooth scrolling, and map system, it's a testament to what the C64 hardware can achieve decades after its release.

Shinobi.desc: As the master ninja Joe Musashi, you must rescue the kidnapped children of your clan from the criminal organization Zeed. This faithful port features classic side-scrolling action where you use shurikens for distance and a katana for close combat. Master the use of Ninja Magic to clear screens of enemies and navigate through multi-layered stages to reach the final showdown.

Sonic the Hedgehog.desc: A technical masterpiece for the C64, this faithful port of the Master System original brings Sega's mascot to the Commodore. Race through iconic zones like Green Hill and Bridge Zone, collecting rings and freeing animals from Dr. Robotnik's robots. Thanks to the REU memory expansion, the game features smooth scrolling and high-speed gameplay that was long considered impossible on this hardware.

Space Rogue.desc: Space Rogue is a groundbreaking hybrid of 3D space combat and top-down RPG exploration. You are a lone pilot who discovers a derelict Sunbeam-class scout ship, using it to trade, fight, and explore the Far Arm sector. Transition seamlessly from wireframe cockpit dogfights and wormhole navigation to overhead exploration of starbases where you interact with NPCs and upgrade your ship.

Star Wars.desc: Based on the 1983 arcade hit, Star Wars puts you in the cockpit of an X-Wing during the assault on the Death Star. The game features three intense phases: dogfighting TIE Fighters in deep space, clearing towers on the Death Star's surface, and the iconic high-speed trench run to deliver the final proton torpedo.

Super Bread Box.desc: An official and incredibly frantic port of Super Crate Box. The goal is simple but deadly: collect as many crates as possible to increase your score. Every crate you pick up instantly swaps your weapon, forcing you to adapt your strategy on the fly. It's a high-speed, chaotic arena shooter that demands perfect reflexes and a bit of luck with the weapon drops.

Turrican II: The Final Fight.desc: Turrican II is a tour de force on the C64, pushing the hardware to its absolute limits. As Bren McGuire, you must battle through five diverse worlds filled with secrets, using an arsenal of upgradable weapons including the powerful Lightning Beam and the iconic Gyroscope transformation. With its vast exploration-based levels and intense Shmup sequences, it is the pinnacle of C64 action gaming.
